body:
The discord invitation has been replaced with an OAuth2 application authorization which adds the user to the discord server. As we grow, this integration will allow us to offer improved service to users who contact us on Discord.

To get to Discord, just click here: https://ruqqus.com/discord

We also removed the announcements modal since it's basically been replaced by +changelog.
body_html:
The discord invitation has been replaced with an OAuth2 application authorization which adds the user to the discord server. As we grow, this integration will allow us to offer improved service to users who contact us on Discord.

To get to Discord, just click here: https://ruqqus.com/discord

We also removed the announcements modal since it's basically been replaced by +changelog.
title: Ruqqus 2.26 - Discord integration improvements

Why is Discord being integrated over something more aligned with Ruqqus's values, like Matrix? I don't mean to sound overly critical, but Discord is spyware and censorship central.

post.body:
The discord invitation has been replaced with an OAuth2 application authorization which adds the user to the discord server. As we grow, this integration will allow us to offer improved service to users who contact us on Discord.

To get to Discord, just click here: https://ruqqus.com/discord

We also removed the announcements modal since it's basically been replaced by +changelog.

body: Seems reasonable. If you haven't already put too much work into it, I've got a spitball: How hard would it be to make a chat that uses Matrix, or something else, as the back-end compared to from scratch? Possibly to not reinvent the wheel, and keep the dev-maintenance cost down.
body_html: Seems reasonable. If you haven't already put too much work into it, I've got a spitball: How hard would it be to make a chat that uses Matrix, or something else, as the back-end compared to from scratch? Possibly to not reinvent the wheel, and keep the dev-maintenance cost down.

parent.body: It's a good stopgap until we have our own built in chat. Widely used, low barrier to entry.
parent.body_html: It's a good stopgap until we have our own built in chat. Widely used, low barrier to entry.

body:
Next integration, we need to give Ruqqus our phone number too, just like Discord?

Actively adding Discord gives the impression that the admins of Ruqqus are somewhat clueless when it comes to privacy. I won't be surprised if I start seeing "Share this Ruqqus discussing on Facebook" with a JavaScript applet. After all, their TOS and Privacy Policy are in the same spirit.

For those who think this is the wrong future for the internet, help build the decentralized, peer 2 peer net with ZeroNet.

Let those who accept phone registration for political discussion go to Discord.

body: No, no. A Ruqqus page as a light web client. You run the front end through Ruqqus. You run the back end on your own servers. Each account has its own matrix account/oAuth tied to it... just like how clicking the discord link works, except it doesn't redirect you to another site. You open a messaging page, the message is passed to the matrix server when you click 'send'... Possibly. I haven't actually planned or read any documentation, besides, I haven't written python since 2.6.
body_html: No, no. A Ruqqus page as a light web client. You run the front end through Ruqqus. You run the back end on your own servers. Each account has its own matrix account/oAuth tied to it... just like how clicking the discord link works, except it doesn't redirect you to another site. You open a messaging page, the message is passed to the matrix server when you click 'send'... Possibly. author.bio:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4
author.bio_html:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4

body:
Discord is a stopgap until we are able to make native Ruqqus chat. 

In the mean time, Discord gets no information about Ruqqus. Ruqqus gets some information about your discord account, uses that information to add you to the server, and that's about it.

If discord wanted Ruqqus information you would be seeing "click below to authorize discord to access your Ruqqus account" rather than the other way around.
body_html:
Discord is a stopgap until we are able to make native Ruqqus chat.

In the mean time, Discord gets no information about Ruqqus. Ruqqus gets some information about your discord account, uses that information to add you to the server, and that's about it.

If discord wanted Ruqqus information you would be seeing "click below to authorize discord to access your Ruqqus account" rather than the other way around.

Why is Discord being integrated over something more aligned with Ruqqus's values, like Matrix? I don't mean to sound overly critical, but Discord is spyware and censorship central.

E: Sorry, didn't mean to join in a horse beating.

post.body:
The discord invitation has been replaced with an OAuth2 application authorization which adds the user to the discord server. As we grow, this integration will allow us to offer improved service to users who contact us on Discord.

To get to Discord, just click here: https://ruqqus.com/discord

We also removed the announcements modal since it's basically been replaced by +changelog.
